review.title: Luxury hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in September. Amazing service from concierge, dining and lounge. The restaurant Paralell 37 served amazing breakfasts and dinners. The gym has state of the art equipment. The lounge was definitely a trendy, cool place to be. We loved the modern decor of the Ritz Carlton. Now one of my favorite hotels.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: Can't say enough about my stay.  Everything was perfect and the staff of the Ritz Carlton were extremely helpful and personable.  I can't say one negative thing.  The recent renovation and upgrades are beautiful as well.

review.title: Nice hotel in a safe area of SF
review.reviewText: Best hospitality around. They really go above and beyond to make you comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel close to many attractions
review.reviewText: I would have probably given this hotel 5 stars, however, we were on the second floor and it was so loud all night long from the traffic that it was hard to sleep. There is also no ventilation in the bathroom making it uncomfortable after using the shower. The staff were nice and the food was great.

review.title: 32nd Anniversary - Ahhh!
review.reviewText: Love San Francisco, but we didn't need to leave the hotel to enjoy this getaway

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in the heart of the city.  Great for business or pleasure

review.title: Food
review.reviewText: There wasn't enough choices on the menu and the main course was not to my liking, and the appetizers were terrible. I had rack of lamb, 4 small pieces about a half dollar round and an 1/8 thick if even that, piled with something I didn't know and that was all, no salad, no potatoes,  nothing else. for the price it sucked.

review.title: Mediocre experience
review.reviewText: I checked in and was put in a room far away, down a flight of stairs and at the end of a hallway. The makeup mirror in the bathroom was clearly and visibly cracked and broken. Either some type of weird cleaning agent had been used in the room, or someone had smoked in there, because I had an immediate allergy attack. Then, upon checking out, I mentioned that my experience at the hotel had issues, and -literally - the clerk said, "Umm hmm," and nothing more. For a luxury hotel at the prices they charge, I would have expected much more.

review.title: Great location great staff
review.reviewText: Very happy with our stay at the ritz Carlton in San Francisco

review.title: Long Weekend Trip To San Francisco
review.reviewText: Arrived in the morning but had no trouble checking in. Room was near the kitchen but we never heard a sound. Room was in great shape and as expected, staff was excellent.

review.title: Nice hotel and staff is outstanding!
review.reviewText: From the arrival to departure was great experience the staff helped and left a first timer to San Fran with a great time!

review.title: close to chinatown
review.reviewText: wonderful beds. great staffs. the building was beautiful and bathroom nice and clean.

review.title: Beautiful luxury hotel in great neighbourhood
review.reviewText: The hotel has great staff, fantastic restaurant for breakfast , and a beautiful lobby bar to enjoy a pre dinner drink.
Spacious rooms, lovely amenities and friendly staff.  Highly recommended for location and quality.

review.title: Great pick, Great location
review.reviewText: Room was surprisingly large for a metro room, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend if the price isn't a problem, as this was about 4x as much as the hotel we stayed in on our inbound trip, which had a similar location. The rooms were dramatically different in size, and I would say the space was the primary difference all other things aside. Great hotel the Ritz never fails to impress with its consistency.
A fantastic stay at the Ritz Carlton in San Francisco.  The room was quite elegant and the staff was truly superb.

review.title: AWESOME & ELEGANT EXPERIENCE!
review.reviewText: Everything you expect and more from an experience at the Ritz was provided to me and my guests and then some. The personal touches, care and service, at all levels was impecable. We felt at home and pampered in all the right ways.  When we asked for special items or service, they did not skip a beat or bat an eye. The Ritz on Nob Hill will forever be our San Francisco vacation home. They earn and deserve their five-star rating everyday! I HIGHLY recommend the Ritz on Nob Hill.
review.positiveRemarks: EVERYTHING. Our room was lovely and well maintained. The service staff from the front door to the restaurant was fantastic, friendly and attentive.
review.locationRemarks: The Ritz Carlton on Nob Hill is wonderfully located to San Francisco attractions, transportation, restaurants, and shops. The PERFECT location.

review.title: Anniversary trip
review.reviewText: Wonderful stay at a beautiful hotel. Service was excellent. Staff were friendly and helpful. They aim to please!
review.locationRemarks: Located on beautiful Nob Hill. Quiet location only minutes away from Chinatown and Union Square.

review.reviewText: Very Good.  clean check in fast and friendly.  8th floor very good.  Good location
review.negativeRemarks: Town Cars not reliable.  Waited 20 minutes finally gave  took taxi

review.title: Awesome stay
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff, very helpful and for the price you get what you paid for.

I stayed on the Club Floor, which provided additional amenities, including unlimited food, beverages, and wine throughout the day.  Top-notch service, very courteous and friendly staff, outstanding customer service.  Gym was  out-of-service for one day. The Ritz Carlton had already made arrangements for guests at two clubs nearby and provided roundtrip transportation at my convenience. I wis I could have extended my stay.

This hotel was perfect the first time we stayed there- which is why I chose to celebrate my husband's 60th birthday there again as a surprise.  I informed the hotel and they even greeted him with "Happy Birthday" but somehow failed to provide any type of birthday amenity in our room. When I brought this to the front desks attention- she offered to provide breakfast the next morning. He is not a breakfast eater but it was a nice gesture. I have to say this stay was disappointing.
The staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant.  The room was small, but nice and clean.

review.title: Warm staff and excellent service.  As expected.
review.reviewText: Rainy days in San Francisco, warn welcome at the door, bell and front desk.  Celebrating my bday and the staff had a card and bottle of wine to celebrate.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is a block away and nothing is more then a $7 uber ride.  Perfectly set in Nob hill.

review.title: The name says it and the experience matched!
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful property and the executive level is quite exceptional. Staff are amazing and very adroit at names, and preferences.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, food, staff and the exceptional quality of the executive floor and lounge.
review.locationRemarks: The Chinese new year parade staff had maps and excellent information, close to excellent shopping and amazing restaurants.

review.reviewText: It's always a pleasure to stay at this hotel.  Great location, great staff, terrific rooms - everything for which you could ask.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location.  Anything you might want to do or anyplace you might want to go are within easy walking distance or a short cab ride.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Great experience. Only thing missing was room slippers which they brought to room immediately when I asked. Stay there. Great place and location

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel.  It is what you would expect from a Ritz-Carlton hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: The daily breakfast, snacks, and drinks at the Club level.  I'd recommend the upgrade to Club Level.
review.locationRemarks: Quick access to everything in the downtown San Francisco area.

review.title: the club rooms are well worth the extra cost.
review.reviewText: felt pampered and taken care of just like I needed. absolutely top drawer.
review.positiveRemarks: the maid service was excellent. My mother had a surprise 96th birthday and the pastry chef made us delicious cupcakes at our request. Candles sparkled
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Expected 5 star, got more!!
review.reviewText: Absolutely blown away, we got the presidential treatment for our anniversary trip. Always the best place in SF and will certainly be back.

review.title: It is The Ritz Carlton!
review.reviewText:
This is the perfect hotel to be in San Francisco ! The Ritz Carlton stands for its  name. The location is perfect, rooms are impeccably clean, staff is polite and professional, gym is spacious and equipment is modern. What else do you need to be perfectly happy?
The weather was rainy during my stay in San Francisco.  I did not find it an issue - my room was so cozy, that I didn't feel going out at all! 

Thank you for making me comfortable at The  Ritz Carlton in SF!
review.locationRemarks: It is near to China Town and Union Square. Street car just over the corner. Plenty of shopping around. Nice little restaurants in the vicinity.

review.title: Hotel and Expedia not coordinated
review.reviewText:
Hotel will not honor membership program if pay through Expedia. No notification of Expedia at booking of hotel. I will discontinue using Expedia.

Only 1 restaurant so how can rate 5 star hotel by Expedia??????
review.positiveRemarks: Not modern facilities and for price overpaid
review.negativeRemarks: Remove from Expedia offering as 5 star experience

review.title: Terrific
review.reviewText: Everything always is terrific at the Ritz.  Never had a bad experience.

review.title: Exactly what I expected.
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, and the guest service was perfect.

review.title: Excellent location, warm staff, facilities average
review.reviewText:
First, the great part of the experience: location is great. Right on chinatown and close to several great little restaurants that the City is famous for. The hotel building is very regal. Although classic is not my style, I enjoyed the historic/heritage architecture.

The hotel staff was very very nice. They went out of their way to make it a memorable stay for us (we were celebrating hubby's landmark birthday). We were given a really nice room. Everyone whom we bumped into, had a warm smile and they were genuinely interested in helping!! (I mean the staff, not the guests. Quite a few guests were very uppity. Heard in the elevator: "xxx says he is a <insert a 4-star hotel chain name> type guy. Donno how he does it?!!")

The room decor is very modern, classy, muted. Very relaxing. Bathroom is exquisite. The double vanity, the crystal knobs, the marble, the trims and moldings - everything is really nice. It was also a spotlessly clean room.

What left something to be desired, was the quality of fixtures. The toilet in the lobby area would not flush properly even after trying multiple times. In the room, the shower could only be so hot. It was still comfortable, so did not have to deal with cold water, but could have dispensed hotter temperature water.

In my opinion, if you end up thinking in a 5-star hotel "my home xxx (shower/toilet/whatever) works better than this" -- then it is a bit of a bummer, isn't it? That happened to me a sometimes. That aside, highly recommeded!!

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our experience was definitely marred by an injury my wife suffered in the hands of masseuse during a massage at the Ritz Carlton Spa. Obviously, the whole vacation & activities planned for the week had to be significantly modified due to the injury. Although the hotel acknowledged that the injury occurred (ie Loss prevention dept was involved), our disappointment was with expecting the hotel management to extend a more caring attitude towards the fact that our vacation was impacted by this injury for which we had absolutely no culpability.  We expected more from the Ritz, especially with customer relations. Instead, it seemed like they avoided us like a plague.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer relations when something on their part goes wrong. We certainly don't appreciate being told that the issue was a "third party".

review.title: Great hotel to stay at San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel!  Very clean, staff very helpful, will stay again.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here for part of our honeymoon. Staff gave complimentary upgrade to club level. Awesome experience will definitely return.

review.title: Great location within the city.
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent.  Treated very well, including help with car services, use of the house car, advice on things to do via the concierge, etc.  Overall, very pleased and happy with our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square.  In the heart of the city.

review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel. Great staff, good location. Very special experience. Spoiled now, wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in San Fran.
review.locationRemarks: Staff gave us great restaurant recommendations.  Scoma near pier 47. Great seafood. North Beach Restaurant in Italian section, wonderful

review.title: Truly a 5 star experience
review.reviewText: Superlative hotel, refurbished to the highest quality. Truly a modern luxury experience

review.title: Fantastic Stay
review.reviewText:
My stay was absolutely wonderful.  Daily the work staff I passed in the halls greeted me with warmth.  My housekeeper for the 4 nights I spent at the RitzCarlton was just "super".  In addition to beautifully refreshing my room daily,  she knew I was in town to celebrate my mom's 90th Birthday Celebration, and asked how it had gone the following day.

My room was very comfortable and I loved the "city views" that I had requested.  My teenage niece joined me on my last night and we both enjoyed the Sunday buffet breakfast.

Thanks for a wonderful experience.  I can't wait to do it again.
review.locationRemarks: I grew up in SF and had to reacquaint myself with the hills, but I welcomed the challenge.

review.reviewText: located near shopping and eating facilities. very comfortable and "homey".  There is no better staff anywhere.

review.title: Great Birthday gift    The place was as good as it
review.reviewText: The place was in the best location for all of the events we wanted to do.  The staff could not have been any better any where.  We were  on the eighth floor with a up grade an it sure was worth all the extra. The views from the room was not the best but I did not come go out there to see the town from the room, get out an walk.lol.
review.positiveRemarks: first class   The room service was to notch   the eight floor was the best
review.negativeRemarks: you tell me   the view is what it is   everything else was dead on
review.locationRemarks: location was just fine for what we wanted to do  the walks were not bad for us

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText: Celebrated our 35th Wedding Anniversary in San Francisco and stayed at the Ritz-Carlton. Everything was beautiful and the facilities and staff were excellent! Thank you for a memorable vacation.

review.title: Nice Hotel with good location
review.reviewText: Stay for a long weekend, Thursday through Sunday. Great place to stay, Hotel location provides good access to Union Square and the Financial District. Also good access to cable car line.
review.positiveRemarks: Newly remodeled, clean, staff was kind.
review.negativeRemarks: Add another elevator bank to service the other side of Hotel. The current distance from elevator to some of the rooms is very far.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel location allows great access to the cable car line. Also with in walking distance to the financial district and Union Square. Good location.

review.title: Nice hotel. Steep slope from Union square
review.reviewText:
Overall: very good experience. As expect in a ritz Carlton hotel. 

Pros: nice bedroom, well furnished, clean, comfortable ( specific the chase :-)), very friendly staff. 

Cons: air con was not working well, and besides it is SF , bedroom was warm. After two days trying to handle it I called the staff to check it and thy promptly solved the issue.
Great hotel, it was in a great location. They had a very friendly staff, its a 5 star hotel for a reason. The room was very spacious, clean, and nicely decorated.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Exceptional Ritz quality in a great location.  Staff is superb and the rooms and facilities are top notch. Enjoyed our stay very much

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Room was good but sink in the bathroom was cracked and seems it had been that way for a while. It was very hard to sleep with too much road noise. Also door bell cover was hissing.
review.negativeRemarks: Better maintenance and better room insulation.
review.locationRemarks: Mainly shopping

review.reviewText: Perfect stay. Excellent service. I'll take quality and fancy over trendy any day.

review.title: Hi John john
review.reviewText:
This is a wonderful hotel with excellent service. 
The restaurants are great and very roomy.
I definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, beautiful and comfortable room and hotel.

Hotel experience was excellent from start to finish. 
Amenities are great, staff very helpful and abliging.
did not eat a restaurant but bar area very nice. 
Cabs very available and easy walk to Chinatown. 
Bed very comfortable.

review.title: Very nice place
review.reviewText: Stayed there for 2 nights. I did not wanted to leave at the end...

review.title: The Ritz Rocks!
review.reviewText: First class all the way!  Every employee we encountered was pleasant, helpful and made an effort to learn your name and make you feel welcomed.  We stayed on the club level and I can't say enough about the quality of service and the outstanding food and beverage we were treated to every day.  The concierges recommended two fantastic restaurants and were eager to help in anyway possible.  The room was comfortable, spacious and the lighting in the bathroom was fantastic - you could actually see to put makeup on.  Loved the Ritz!
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants nearby.  Short walk to Chinatown, Union Square, Coit tower, shopping, etc.

review.title: Within walking distance of good restaurants.
review.reviewText: The room was very expensive. The noise from traffic was difficult to fall asleep to. The overall cleanliness of the room was good but 'dusting' details very neglected.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was close to the tram cars, close to shopping and good restaurants.

review.title: exquisite hotel close to union square/chinatown
review.reviewText: Great properties, decently spacious room, very good service, but quite pricey for room service. Overall Worth

review.title: George & Dawn
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice but we had a very bad experience.  My companion left her dress in the closet, I saw it there that morning because I took a robe out of the closet.  She called and was told that the dress was not there, meaning the staff took the free or disposed of the dress.  I could see this happening at a Red Roof Inn, but at the Ritz Carlton on the Club floor, I find it outrageous!  At over $600 a night you expect better.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice facility, the club level was nice but the food was the same both days for breakfast.  The wait staff and connoisseur staff were great!
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning Staff, managements response to theft of customers property, would be a good start
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Chinatown, Little Italy, and Fishermans Warf

review.title: Excellent customer service
review.reviewText:
Quiet, immaculately clean. 
Staff are friendly, attentive, and helpful. 
Excellent location. Walking distance to Union square, Chinatown, Powell st cable car to fishermans wharf.

review.title: Place is terrible
review.reviewText: Do not stay here. Place is terrible. Staff is terrible, managers are worse. This should not be a a Ritz. Dirty room, terrible service, terrible food, stay anywhere else.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing. Location is terrible

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: I would stay there again. No complaints. Great hotel and staff.

review.title: Attempt at sophistcated peaceful elegance
review.reviewText: Beautiful luxurious facility with professional attentive accommodating staff, but the experience of club level elegance and serenity was seriously eroded by the presence of children. No matter their level of manners, age-appropriate behavior or parental supervision/discipline, club level environs are not the place for even the best behaved child. Children get excited and enthusiastic in vacation. Their animation while adorable is not peaceful and calming to non-family. All toddlers squeal, chatter and don't yet know how to modulate their voice. This is no endictment on such normal behavior nor on parents who try to redirect them to shhhh or use their indoor voice. It just is not approroriate to have to block out such 'normal' situations in this type place anymore so than it would be in a library or symphony performance. Worse yet was having to navigate the unsupervised pre-teens obliviously running down a hallway.  In previous yrs we were either lucky or perhaps there was then an adults-only policy. As wonderful as the accommodations, food, drink and staff consistently were, the disruption and general change in atmosphere resulting from the presence of kids between the ages of about 5 and 15, I will be reluctant to return to club level again unless limits have been placed on the admittance of children.
review.positiveRemarks: The updating, cleanliness and elegance of the spaces. The professionalism, courteousness and knowledge of the staff about the hotel and the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Limit club level accommodations to adults only.
review.locationRemarks:
Stockton St. SanFrancisco, CA
Walking distance to Chinatown, shopping, variety of nightlife entertainment.

review.title: Staff was great
review.reviewText: Service made for a wonderful and delightful visit
Wonderful personal care, doorman remembers your name, conceriage very helpful, staff goes above and beyond to make you feel special

review.title: Not as Advertised: Promise not kept.
review.reviewText: While the renovated rooms are lovely, the lower floors have old windows which sound like they are open. NO Pay per View or movie selection, as advertised.  I spoke with manager who said they may NEVER bring in pay-per-view again, offered a credit, then never gave it. If you are in for a rainy night (or a few in San Francisco), this may be problem, as it was for us. Manager offered a credit to my 4 night room charge for the inconvenience, but did not deliver. No movies, no compensation for amenity not provided as advertised.

review.title: 40th anniversary
review.reviewText: Wonderful getaway with great pampering   Champagne sent to room. Extra touches when dining. Superb concierge assistance. A typical Ritz experience that we've come to expect...and enjoy.

review.title: Great hotel, close to the Tonga Room for dancing.
review.reviewText: Very attentive, pleasant staff!  Beautiful Rooms.  We wanted a hotel that was reasonably priced but still 4 star or higher that was close to the Fairmont, which was very expensive, so we could walk to The Tonga Room.  The Ritz was 2 blocks and a reasonable walk even in heels!  We had a Great night of dancing, came back to the Ritz around 12:30 am and ordered breakfast to be delivered at 9:30.  They were right on time and the breakfast was Great!  Our car was downstairs and ready for us within 10 minutes of our call.  Thanks for a Wonderful stay Ritz-Carlton!
review.positiveRemarks: The amenities and decor were very nice.
review.locationRemarks: With in walking distance to the Tonga Room for fun dining and dancing!

review.reviewText:
Concierge service  was great.  Both Ric & Oscar very helpful.
I have heard so much about the personal service from everyone at the RitzCarlton.  Only experienced it with the concierge service.   Everyone else was pleasant but did not find them any more so than many other hotels.  I suppose my expectations were too high.  
Very nice hotel & service regardless.  
Unable to adjust room temperature to desired level.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of san francisco.  Near Chinatown, short walk to wharf.  Very convenient

review.title: Nice Hotel and close to many local attractions.
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was amazing. Everyone was very polite and helpful. Would highly recommend staying here and my wife and I cant wait to come back.

review.title: Very classy hotel for the price!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with great service! Classy hotel, reasonably priced and a good location.

review.title: Excellent retreat
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, excellent location!  Staff is detailed-oriented, nothing is left to chance for customers to experience a luxurious vacation.
Fine hotel  friendly  great time.  service was good
review.positiveRemarks: clean up to date good location

review.title: Super hotel and location
review.reviewText: Club concierge excellent . All staff friendly and efficient
Only spent one night but look forward to returning

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: The Ritz was everything a hotel guest could hope for.

review.title: HEART OF SAN FRANSISCO
review.reviewText: Very nice - as you would expect a Ritz Carlton to be.  Dining is limited and too costly.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good location.  Very helpful concierge.
review.locationRemarks: Few blocks to Chinatown & Union Square.

review.title: Very good place to stay
review.reviewText: like it very much, but the food there is just soso, very limited choice and the restaurant will not always be open, only for Tuesday and Saturday.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: I was there for my honey moon, was very nice! The room was perfect

review.title: Great customer service
review.reviewText:
When we first arrived we had difficulty finding our room and kept getting sent in the wrong direction.  After seeing our frustration in trying to find our room the hostess from the Parallel 37 Restaurant came out and assisted us.  She then sent us a very nice bottle of wine as an apology for the incident.  

This lady single handedly turned our negative mood around into a great one.  Things will always go wrong, what makes for good service is how the company makes up for it.

Thank you!

review.title: Convenient to everything.
review.reviewText: Valet parking very pricey, but overall a comfortable stay. Convenient to trolley to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel that is located in the heart of San Francisco. The staff is super attentive. The rooms are clean and nicely sized. We had a great stay.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and it's in a good location, on block from chinatown and four  blocks from union square. It has a nice fitness center, small but cozy bar and restaurant.  Staff was friendly and the food is really good.  However, I noticed other hotels that where far better at the same price. For instance the Fairmont is gorgeous and the JW Marriot is right in front of Union Square. In general, my stay at the Ritz was good and this hotel is always a nice option anywhere you go.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, the rooms, the food and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge can do a lot better in guiding you. The hotel is relatively small compared to others in the same category
review.locationRemarks:
Chinatown is one block away 
There's a cable car stop right next to the hotel 
Union Square is just four block away

review.title: dissapointing
review.reviewText: It certainly didn't meet the expectations we had previously about the Ritz.  The carpets were dirty, the service was just ok

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. Gorgeous property. Outstanding staff! Everything we expected!!
The trip was short but hotel disappointing . Could not get into High Tea. Too many extra charges. Taxes parking etc. just worn out rooms and restaurants

review.title: Beautiful hotel, BUT.....
review.reviewText: The Ritz Carlton hotel is beautiful, no doubt about that BUT the young women at the front desk and in reservations were not friendly nor kind. Actually border line rude. Refered to Expedia as if, beneath them. I am not sure why they would care where or how I booked my stay there. I was very sad to see this as I have always loved the Ritz Carlton.

review.title: Amazing hotel!
review.reviewText: Everything was really nice! I will definitely go back some day.

review.title: Nice classic hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great but I had problems with housekeeping and the bell men gave us wrong suitcases when we checked out and we had to ship the stranger's suitcases to the hotel

review.title: It's an average Ritz Carlton
review.reviewText:
The hotel is kind of old the doorknob for my bathroom broke also some other minor issues like the dated flatscreen TV that I couldn't hook up my Roku was a disappointment. however whatever this hotel lacked in facility they made it up and excellent service.
In addition the location of the hotel was excellent near Chinatown and a short walk from the Union Square however the view from the hotel was mediocre.
Nice hotel.  Good location and good staff.  Only complaints are the hallways - could use a refresh. Nice view out the side window from the 6th (2nd lowest) floor of the bay and Transamerica.

review.title:
Outstanding club level service food
and staff
review.reviewText:
We were especially impressed with
club level(8th fl) staff and service.
Rivals best hotels in world I have been to! Bravo!
We had a suite on the 6th floor. It was huge! Everything was perfect. The furniture in the living room is starting to show signs of wear but nothing bad. Overall a wonderful stay.

Very nice hotel BUT I booked several rooms with 2 beds and on arrival they only had one king.  Extra people had to sleep in rollaway beds.  They said the reservation for 2 beds was just a request ... not guaranteed.  Why not?

review.title: Resurge gala
review.reviewText: Always love staying at this particular ritz. Always makes you feel like royalty!  Such great service at a time when service isn't emphasized enough!  Left coat at hotel. Returned quickly. Thanks!
A++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ hotel. Much recommended. And location is right in the center of the city

review.title: Ritz Calton has changed
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Ritz Calton in Cancun, and it was marvelous just this year with our friends, so we decided to stay at the one in San Francisco. 

To start with no one helped with the bags
Receptionist / staff very cold / not even a hello
Room was dirty. carpets by closet, carpet by entrance, and this was a suite too, not a regular room. 
Elevator a, did not work, got stuck on the 7th floor. You cannot push the lobby button. Called down stairs , it was not fixed till the next day. 

We requested a room with a view if available, and when we got there the front desk had an attitude and told us: 

" We are not known for our views " 

I could not believe their answer, rude. 

Thank you, 

Benny Borsakian 
I will personally never stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Great location: Chinatown, Little Italy, and close to the bay. Museums, Churches, ferry .

review.title: Nice hotel in financial district
review.reviewText: Excellent experience with incredible staff on club level. Spa was a little disappointing because there was no pool and the steam room was small and extremely hotter than was comfortable.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: I was pleased with my choice of hotel in San Francisco.  However, I had two issues.  1.  Not being able to record  my points for Ritz Carlton: and 2.  The isolation of the hotel from other restaurant choices.  There was only one restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel maintained the standard that I have become used to for Ritz Carlton.
review.negativeRemarks: A coffee shop with less formal meals.
review.locationRemarks: I have already mention the isolation of the hotel from other restaurant choices.  The distance to the shopping areas and museums is a bit too far.

review.title: ok hotel
review.reviewText: This is an ok hotel, not worth the money even in the middle of San Francisco.

review.title: Not as Nice as the Fairmont
review.reviewText: Let's face it - the Ritz costs a boat-load of money to stay at so expectations are high and this beautiful old Hotel is starting to look a little threadbare. The staff was excellent and, had I not visited the Fairmont, I might have thought more of the Ritz but... the Fairmont is better situated even though it's just two blocks away - in San Francisco that might as well be the Bhutan Death March (my apologies to  anybody who actually survived the Bhutan Death March) and the Fairmont just way, way nicer!

review.title: What a brilliant experience.
review.reviewText:
The Ritz Carlton San Francisco was the most brilliant experience. The Hotel and all of its staff were exceptional. The staff, from the Front Door, to Reception, to Concierge and House Staff,  were most professional and courteous and no request was a problem.
We celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary and the Hotel had a bottle of Champagne and a Congratulations Card in our room upon our arrival. What a delightful thought. The food in the hotel was beautiful and the complimentary fruit at Reception was excellent.
If we ever get the money saved to visit San Francisco again, we will definitely stay in the Ritz Carlton. In fact, our experience was so good, we will always use the Ritz Carlton Hotel Group when we travel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing , the entire experience was exceptional.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel is just 10 minutes walk from Union Square where there is excellent shopping, restaurants. once you get to know the way around San Francisco.

review.title: Very nice hotel in an excellent location
review.reviewText: They gave me a complimentary ride to breakfast in a Mercedes S class since the restaurant was close by...very nice
I think the Ritz Carlton people must send all their employees to charm school.  Every one of them was extremely courteous, efficient, and super friendly.

review.title: Very disappointing
review.reviewText: We were looking forward to staying there and were very disappointed. We arrived 4 of us as stated on our confirmation from Expedia to be told by hotel staff that they only had a king bed for the 4 of us. The reception attendant offered no solution other than to tell me the hotel has had this problem with Expedia. I asked for the manager and we were given one roll away bed our other daughter 11 years old slept in a chair for two nights. They offered no solution despite my persistence and printed confirmation from Expedia!

review.title: Extremely comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Spent 5 nights in total in a club room. Very comfortable. Only draw back no separate shower, but other than that a very nice bathroom with a good selection of toiletries. The club lounge was very useful, with a varied selection of food and drink throughout the day, which meant that if you didn't want to you did not have to go out to eat. Main drawback to the hotel,(apart from the cost) is that the walk to the hotel from Union Square includes one very steep hill.
Staff was friendly and hotel was clean!  If you are looking for a relaxing hotel to escape the city buzz, then The Ritz would be a good sanctuary.  Enjoy

review.title: The staff was exceptional!!
review.reviewText: Everyone was exceptional from the front door to check in and room service. Upon departing I needed a car and one was delivered to the hotel within an hour. I cannot say enough. And the hotel was, of course, beautiful!

review.title: Bates Family Stay
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ritz Carlton in San Francisco. The hotel staff were awesome from the doormen to the cleaning staff. Five days/four nights and everyday was as if we just arrived. They welcomed us every time we came back from our days excursions. I would stay there again and recommend this to all my friends and family.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything from the staff to the location.
review.locationRemarks: Just a trolley ride or short walk away from Chinatown, Shopping and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Can't beat Ritz Carlton great location and a lovely hotel.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Concierge fabulous. Driver for three days -- Fred -- wonderfully knowledgeable, warm, friendly, flexible.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in bad. Room not ready, no communication.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect Location

review.title: not what i expected
review.reviewText:
i reserved the room asking for 2 beds as we had our 11 year old grandchild traveling with us,
it was confirmed by the hotel that we wiuld get what we requested as that was an option during booking.
when we went to check in they informed us that they gave us one bed and a foldable bed i was not happy and complained but they said that is the best they could do and were also rude.
the foldable was very uncomfortable so the three of us shared the bed.
they did the same to another traveler.
review.negativeRemarks:
the courtyard was nice although the water fountain was off.
there were cigaret buds all over.

review.title: Nice for a price.
review.reviewText: The room we paid for was unavailable and the hotel was fully booked.  First we were put into a room that was tiny with only one bed for three.  I pleasantly requested a new room or a refund, we were given a larger room but with only one bed.  Having to use a cot in a 5star is low brow.
review.locationRemarks: Everything

review.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: Checking-in and -out was very easy.  The staff was friendly and welcoming.  Wish we had more time to enjoy the amenities (i.e. the fitness center and the lounge) at the hotel.  We would be happy staying at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location.  The hotel is on a quiet block of Stockton St.  Yet, it's in a very convenient area.
review.locationRemarks: On the corner, you can hop on a cable car (California Line).  Union Square is 3-4 blocks away.

review.title: Can't wait to get back!
review.reviewText: We travel a lot And we have to say that Ritz was super! Awesome service, Great location, beautiful hotel, And the food at the hotel wow!!. We have a baby 10 months And They even have a welcome bag for him!! We love it we highgly recomend it!

review.title: Nice hotel, good location if you rent a car
review.reviewText: The hotel was really comfortable. The rooms are big and really clean, the bed is super comfy. The hotel is  Not in the best location for walking distance. I highly recommend it if you rent a car. The hotel parking was really expensive per night so we parked on a garage nearby and the rates were less expensive ($39 per night compared to $79).

review.title: Top class hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 5 nights on a business trip to San Francisco.  On arrival I was pleased to be upgraded to Club Level! The room was a little on the small side at this price point and there was no separate shower but overall the quality of the accommodation was first rate.  Luxuriously comfortable bed! Housekeeping staff were excellent and the complimentary evening shoe shine was a classy touch.  The food offering on club level was first rate with an excellent breakfast buffet, tasty lunchtime treats and champagne and cocktails in the evening. Delicious! Free wifi on club level was also an unexpected bonus.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Excellent food. Superior service.
review.locationRemarks: Good central location within easy reach of downtown or Fisherman's Wharf area. Steep walk back up the hill at the end of the day is only downside!

review.title: Grand historic hotel with outstanding service
review.reviewText: Very comfortable stay in good location for a fun weekend in SF.  Staff were very pleasant and helpful, and attentive to details.  Parallel 37 restaurant prix fixe dinner was outstanding, including the wine pairings.
review.positiveRemarks: The architecture, condition, service, food, bedding, art, fitness centre...
review.locationRemarks: Handy location for walking or cable car access to Chinatown, Union Square shopping, North Beach and even Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: There are much better hotels in San Francisco for
review.reviewText: We requested two rollaway beds for our suite. Upon arrival they informed us that they had no more rollaways. with two teenagers we needed separate beds. Basically they just blew it off at the front desk. While they were polite and gave us lipservice it was clear they really didn't care and made no effort to come to a solution. We finally had to request that they bring some pillow top mattress's  blankets and sheets for the floor.

review.title: very good hotel, far from attractions
review.reviewText: hotel itself is great. all services, including restaurant were awesome. the only downside was its a long walk away from union square and hotel does not offer any shuttle services. tried in room dining and not disappointed.

review.title: Oversold hotel!!!
review.reviewText: When we arrive late night for check in the staff told us that the hotel was oversold so they dont have any rooms available...!!! Even when I paid almost three months in advance!!! Nothing to do... They sent us to another hotel. I expect more from this hotel but its like a motel 6. They don't respect their clients

review.title: Five Star Hotel & Amazing Staff
review.reviewText:
We reside in Texas.  Texans are known to be friendly and hospitable people.  We are.  Your staff made us feel very comfortable and very welcome. The bellhops were amazing. The young ladies at the desk lovely.  Mr. Alexander Starksky and Mr. Alexander Vincent were genuinely kind, very gracious and informative. The ladies who serve guest at the eight floor Club Lounge were family. Beautiful people, very kind, very warm. 
Your staff made this the best five star hotel experience thus far.   We are very appreciative to all.

Gregory & Martha Johnson
review.positiveRemarks: The décor, the employees, and the hours and presentations at The Club Lounge.
review.negativeRemarks: The route shuttles take to the hotel from the airport.
review.locationRemarks: I think we enjoyed most if not all of the tourist attractions.

review.title: Nice hotel but not the Ritz!
review.reviewText:
Room was not ready when we arrived at 4pm.  Kind of felt like a second class customer by some of the front desk staff.  
The concierge staff were pleasant and very helpful.  

Great trip and in the end liked the location of the hotel.  Might try the Fairmont (one block away) next time.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, clean and homey feeling after a long day exploring.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure.  Just not what I expected from the Ritz.  Maybe my expectations for a five-star hotel is off.
review.locationRemarks: Midway between Wharf and Union Sq. and adjacent to Chinatown.  Very steep hills.  Cable car lines within a block very helpful but crowded.

review.title: Extremely nice and convenient hotel
review.reviewText: I always stay at the Ritz-Carlton when I need a hotel in San Francisco, and I have never been disappointed.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jeremy,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I appreciate your candid remarks and apologize that there were several issues during your stay. Your feedback is key to our success in the future and is appreciated.

Warm Regards,
Jim B

review.title: City Break in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant stay at the Ritz Carlton but it definitely didn't meet the standards you would normally hope for. Check-in was very slow though they weren't busy. The bathrooms for the main restaurant were pretty dirty and graffiti was scrawled on the door. Breakfast was pretty chaotic and we didn't get things we had ordered whilst other cooked stuff arrived cold.
review.positiveRemarks: We did have a fantastic evening meal in the main restaurant - the service was great and the food absolutely superb
review.negativeRemarks: A bit more attention to service (apart from the restaurant)

review.title: Maybe i was expecting to much?
review.reviewText: The building wasn't in great shape. The steam room didn't work. There wasn't a pool anymore. My bed was saggy and my back.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk person Alex, she was great!
review.locationRemarks: Very good location.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Great food and services, like you would expect from a 5 star hotel.The hotels needs some upgrades but  would recommend this hotel!
Awesome! Staff, facility & amenities are all 1st class

review.title: Good place, helpfull staff
review.reviewText: We stayed in the hotel for family vacation. We felt as in home.
review.positiveRemarks: Good place, smiling and helpfull staff, cleaness
review.negativeRemarks: A shuttle between union square and/or Fisherman's Warf may be cool
review.locationRemarks: Good place but still you have to walk up a hill. Too near to anywhere for taxis. A Shuttle may be a good idea.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: I was very unlucky when I stayed they were remodeling first and second floor...  No gym :(..  No body mention remodeling when I was booking!
The staff was especially helpful (valet,concierge,front desk)

review.title: 50th anniversary
review.reviewText: Excellent stay, the 37th paralal restraunt was excellent, we only had breakfast ther twice but our waitress )Teressa) was wonderful, very friendly. She seemed like she knew us and cared about our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: We met there 50 years ago at Metropolitan life ins. Co. So it was the perfect place to stay at for our 50th anniversary.

review.title: improvement on front desk service required
review.reviewText: can't find staff at front desk in the late evening or even early morning !!

Hotel was fantastic. My only complaint is about parking. Even for San Francisco, I think $64 per night plus tourism taxes for a total of over $73 is outrageous. They should factor some of this into room cost. My $299 rate finished at over $400 for 1 night.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was honestly beautiful and the staff was very helpful. However, It being the Ritz, I have to say, the room had not been cleaned as I would have expected it to be. It had stuff from the person who was in it before me. Including a used toothbrush and mouthwash. I hope they change sheets... But again, the staff really made up for it and the location can not be toped.
review.locationRemarks: You have all the shopping and a cute park very close! Its between beautiful hills and views :)

review.title: Perfect location for 3-days in the City!
review.reviewText: Location was perfect! Welcome upon arrival was top-notch, Robert showed us to our room - one of the best introductions to a city and hotel we've ever had. The room was comfortable and well-appointed. Every staff member was professional, polite - beyond helpful. Parallel 37 staff were personable, helpful. Bell staff, doormen, front desk - honestly, just great folks! Couldn't ask for a more comfortable and friendly welcome back every day. We were so impressed....until we used (tried to use) the concierge desk.....twice. Don't bother with their concierge. The only negative from our entire 3-day weekend was the concierge desk - weren't helpful, were uninterested, curt with their responses to our inquiries, made us feel like an imposition. We would stay again, would not hesitate to recommend ...... with that one caveat.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car is right outside the door! Chinatown is a block away. Union Square (and fabulous shopping) is a quick 10 minute walk away. Great location!

review.title: A most pleasant and relaxing hotel
review.reviewText:
From the moment we arrived to when we left, the staff - every single one, from doorman to chamber maid - were friendly and helpful.
The team was aware that we were in town to celebrate our son's graduation, and they bent over backwards to spoil us and make it a special occasion. It was the little things, the free movie, the popcorn, the congrats balloon etc etc etc which impressed us.
We have decided to make staying at the Ritz Carlton in SF an annual event

review.title: Beautiful hotel with great views of Nob Hill!
review.reviewText: This is the second Ritz Carlton we have stayed and like the one in New Orleans, this one was also a wonderful experience!!! The hotel staff was amazing!!! Everyone was pleasant and went over and above to make our trip the best stay for us!!! Meet had a corner room that was beautiful!!! Our experiences with the Ritz Carlton will make it difficult to stay in other hotels!!!

review.title: Disappointing Ritz.
review.reviewText: I have stayed in the Ritz all over the world . Great hotel. In San Francisco I booked a suite two months in advance. I requested a king/queen bed and I wanted the best view possible. What I was told at check- in was that they only had double beds because of a large convention in the hotel. It took two more calls with the manager to get a room with a queen bed. My "city view" was non-existent. When I complained, they said the Ritz is not known for its views. Now I know that! I moved to the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins and for a lower rate had a spectacular view of the bay, the Golden Gate Bridge, as well as my own sun room, and very large balcony. I won't go back to the Ritz again.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge service was great as usual.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The room was very well appointed and comfortable. The decor of the lobby and the restaurant are not up to the standard of a first class hotel. I expected something different from a Ritz Carlton in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor of the public areas, particularly the lobby and the lobby restaurant. The latter looks and feels like a second rate cafeteria.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your kind remarks from your recent visit. We are excited that you had a great time during your stay at The Ritz-Carlton, San Francisco. We look forward to your next visit to the "City by the Bay"!

Kind Regards-

Allen Highfield
General Manager

review.title: Wonderful old school luxury in the heart of SF.
review.reviewText: The staff is amazing. The rooms are dated but solid and clean, great wonderful friendly staff. Perfect location, literally a stones throw from Chinatown, Union Square, Nob Hill, Belden Place, Cable Cars, Catholic Churches, Buddhist Temples, Rolex watches and chotchkes from China.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff in the club level are amazing, great, friendly helpful and ever attentive.
review.negativeRemarks: The styling is old school and the light switches in the rooms are a little wanting in terms of ease of use and brightness.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, literally a stones throw from Chinatown, Union Square, Nob Hill, Belden Place, Cable Cars, Catholic Churches, Buddhist temples.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, walking distance from china town and union square

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel, room, services. Great location

Overpriced car parking and breakfast. Also windows not enough sound proof
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing of windows Cheaper car parking

Kind Regards-

Allen Highfield

review.title: Great location on historic Nob hill
review.reviewText: Chef had a wonderful tasting menu. Great pet friendly hotel. Everyone from the doormen to the spa personnel were really friendly and professional.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Great location and atmosphere!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time, great staff and spectacular food!

review.title: Hotel was nice
review.reviewText: Overall experience good but someone had a dog in the room next to us that continually barked

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Very Welcoming!!!
review.reviewText: We had a great room on the Club Floor...as such had access to the Club room facilities during our stay...breakfast was always superb and very generous....various snacks were available throughout the day with an excellent choice of drinks to accompany them. The concierge team couldn't have been more efficient and helpful which made our stay a memorable one!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and efficient staff with comfortable accommodation
review.locationRemarks: Location is in Nob Hill which is the best area to be located...it has easy access to all the main attractions.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Excellent hotel conveniently located.
review.reviewText: The stay was enjoyable and comfortable. We did feel that considering the cost of everything else that wifi could have been included at no extra cost.

review.title: A good trip
review.reviewText: Travel and manage their business.I love the best hotels and recreation. So use Expedia. com. I recommend you a lot of bisnes partners and friends and all people.
review.positiveRemarks: As a guest of this hotel, I can say that everything was perfect.

managementResponses.response:

We look forward to your next visit.
Kind Regards-
