review.title: Wow!
review.reviewText: After reading a few negative reviews (most of the reviews were very positive) I decided to give this hotel a try. We stayed for a week in a suite and couldn't be more pleased. The staff was very courteous. The cleaning staff was attentive and NEVER bothered us when our "Shh" sign was out. The restaurant was very good with excellent service. All I can say is amazing in every way. If your want a high end hotel with high end service this is the place!
review.locationRemarks: We went to Alcatraz, fisherman's wharf, rainforest restaurant, Lombard street, etc.

review.title: Great location, centrally located.
review.reviewText:
From the car service to things to do nearby, we were very pleased.
Everything in the hotel was clean. The staff is very pleasant and helpful.
The restaurants around the area were great.
Fisherman's Wharf was good! The Franciscan had good food.
Just a very pleasant trip for my wife and I.
The people in the shops around the area were also very kind. No bad attitudes were to be found.
review.locationRemarks: Everything we wanted to see and do was within 10 minutes of the hotel. Cab rides were quick when needed. And the Hotel car service came in handy too

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The gym is very large and has everything you'd need for a good workout. Front staff, valet and bellmen are all very nice, attentive and accommodating.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Val-
Thank you very much for sharing your review of our property on Expedia after your visit to San Francisco. It was a pleasure to hear that your interaction with our Ladies and Gentlemen left a lasting impression on your visit. In addition, I would definitely agree that our location here in the "City by the Bay" is primary for tourist and business travelers.
In addition, I understand your concerns about the overall condition of the property. I am pleased to inform you that the hotel plans a renovation of all of our meeting space this summer and all the guest rooms and public space in the fall of 2014. We look forward to your return visit to enjoy the new product.
We appreciate your patronage and feedback.
Kind Regards-
Allen Highfield
General Manager

review.title: Old and insufficient noise isolation.
review.reviewText: It is quite old hotel and everything look used. I wish room had better noise isolation.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great for tourists.

review.title: Terrible Beds.
review.reviewText: Everything was FINE not excellent. However, the beds were terrible. Yes the bedding was good (not great "as advertised") but the beds themselves were obviously inexpensive. I will not stay there again.

review.title: Peaceful hotel in the middle of big city
review.reviewText: Overall experience was wonderful, just what we were looking for. Staff was very accommodating. We arrived at 9 am and they gave us our room right away. Bar area was crowded in a good way, fun and civilized. Only complaint is we were in the older part of the hotel and would have preferred the feeling of new.

review.title: Great location and luxury stay
review.reviewText: Spent 6 nights including NYE. Dinner was amazing and staff very friendly. Our room was huge and very luxurious.
review.positiveRemarks: They changed our towels everyday even though we asked that they do not for environmental reasons.
review.locationRemarks: Great location and very close to good French restaurants.

review.title: Delightful in every respect
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was gracious and hospitable. Dinner at the hotel's Parallel 37 restaurant was wonderful. We enjoyed the easy access to the California Street cable car and San Francisco Chinatown. The overall experience was memorable. This trip was a one-night get away since we live nearby in the Sacramento area.

review.negativeRemarks: Located on quite a steep hill from the main area from union square. However, taking the cable car means no walking.

review.title: Upscale, well located hotel.
review.reviewText: My primary reason for an "ok" rating rather than higher is due to my check-in experience. I had booked two double beds since I was traveling with my daughter. They assigned us one king saying my preference was only a request. I am certain I "booked" the reservation for two doubles. After some searching they found us the correct room. Next, our luggage didn't arrive to our room. I found a bellman who discovered the front desk attendant had thrown away the claim check. We found our luggage in the storage closet and I carried it to our room myself. Finally, I recalled I had forgotten my razor. They said they would send one to my room. It never arrived. Not a good first impression. Other than that, this is a nice, quiet hotel. Just average restaurant and bar area. Below average for other Ritz Carltons in which I have stayed.
review.positiveRemarks: Valet parking attendants and room service personnel are first rate. Genuinely friendly and service oriented.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in staff could use some training. My first contact was unacceptable. I'm sure many will find the WiFi charges annoying.
review.locationRemarks: Good location away from the crowds. Older guests may have to cab it back from as the hill is quite steep.

review.title: Hotel on the hill not to big.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed that we had to go up to get to the lobby by elevator
review.positiveRemarks: The nice big rooms and all the marble.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast menu was confusing, took long time to get food, was good though.
review.locationRemarks: Union square three blocks away, China town near also. cable cars everywhere

review.title: Great place to stay in SF!
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a great place to stay that is very centrally located, the SF Ritz is it. Simple, but upscale, you'll get the normal Ritz service. Rooms are a good size (rare for SF) and up to date. I will definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: It's a Ritz, what's not to like? The location is fabulous.

review.title: Amazing service. Really live up to the Rit name.
review.reviewText: They were extremely friendly and upgraded us when they found out that we were local and escaping the kids for the night.

review.title: Great facility, great location, tremendous service
review.reviewText: This was my first visit to this hotel and whenever I return to SF, I will stay at the Ritz. It was first class all the way. Stay in a suite if you can and experience the Club Level. The staff is tremendous and whoever is the managing exec of this hotel is doing a great job. I was very impressed.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything!!!! There were too many things to pick one.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location near Union Square. Centrally located to nearly everything that matters.

review.title: Noise
review.reviewText: Room faced an elementary school with loud whistling and shouting outside my window by the school crossing guard early in the am. Suggest betetr sound insulation or a warning.

review.title: Would recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: It's a beatiful building with interesting location. In overall, we have very good opinion. I would recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, spacy room, tasty & healthy food available
review.locationRemarks: Nood good since next to Chinatown

review.reviewText: Great location - we walked just about everywhere - steep inclines and lots of stairs though. Fabulous service. Beautiful room , very quiet, extremely comfortable bed and bathroom facilities. Club level lounge is outstanding!

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the service and the hospitality. The quality of food was average and over price. The $ 70.00 per night was a surprise and excessive. Most hotels do not charge parking for resident guest.
review.locationRemarks: Excellant

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, nice rooms, friendly and efficient staff. Good location, walking distance to Union Square and shopping areas.

review.title: A gift to ourselves
review.reviewText: After spending time in Sonoma, we were booked into a hotel for a couple of nights in San Francisco. A friend who lives in the city gave us some feedback about our initial choice of hotels; namely, that it was going to be a disaster. Taking her cue, a few days before our arrival I booked two nights at the Ritz on their club floor knowing full well the cost but deciding that my wife and I needed and wanted a memorable hotel experience. To be brief : our stay at the Ritz-Carlton in SF was extraordinary. In every way the hotel was more than we could have wished. We opted for the Club booking because once before, in NYC, we had gifted ourselves a Club stay and this time, it was better than that. The staff is unbelievably attentive, going out of their way to pamper their guests, the bed superb for sleeping and everything just as you'd like it. And, and this is a major factor, the refreshments provided on the Club floor (at every meal plus evening desserts and drinks) were just flat out fabulous. Not being particularly interested in running around the city after a day of sightseeing (we could be faulted for that, but we had been all over the place in Sonoma), having our own gourmet pantry was the height of luxury, if not decadence. If you can do it, don't deprive yourself of such pleasure.

review.title: Nice hotel, very expensive----600/ night
review.reviewText: Everything was ok except room was too hot....called front desk, they sent repairman, still too hot
review.locationRemarks: China town,restaurants

review.title: Don't waste your money.
review.reviewText:
When you stay at a Ritz and spend $500 a night for a room you expect an exceptional experience. I have had that experience at other Ritz hotels but not at the Ritz San Francisco. This is a very average hotel. There are many hotels in the San Francisco area you could stay at for half the price and get the same standard. This hotel needs to be updated all around. They also need to stop wacking there guest an additional charge for internet services. If your paying $500 for a nights stay you expect internet service at no additional charge.
If you want the Ritz experience go else where.
review.negativeRemarks: The rugs, the beds, the towels, the concierge, the T.V
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Right out the door and your in China Town. Little Italy just down the road from China Town.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful stay. I though wasn't paying $600 per night :)

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They offer a house car free of charge for locations within a short distance from the hotel, which was very convienant.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco, located next door to China Town. Close proximity to all of the attractions.

review.title: Welcome luxury
review.reviewText: The rooms are clean and very comfortable, sheets, towels in excellent conditions, completely isolated of the noise in the streets, the staff was very kind and friendly, the bar at the lobby is a great place to have drinks with friend
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms and the frendly staff and of course the location
review.negativeRemarks: Provide WI FI, internet connection in rooms please !!we already have 13 year on the 21th century and still charging for it,
review.locationRemarks: Union square, restaurants, ride in the cable car, banks, etc

review.title: what's not to like.
review.reviewText:
The concierge got us tickets to tour Alcatrez despite them being sold out. They bend over backwards to ensure you have a
great stay. The gym had the latest high tech equipment and I enjoyed the steam room every day.
review.negativeRemarks: Only improvement would be if it was closer to Fishermans Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: A nice walk, or cab ride to just about anything. It's the walk back that kills you. We walked down and then took a cab or cable car back to the ritz

review.title: Old Hotel, not impressed
review.reviewText: Expecting the BEST from a Ritz Carleton...Very classy but very dated...First thing the kids noticed, the faucets are so short when you rinse your hands, they rub the backside of the sink...Yuck!

review.title: Very Nice hotel. Staff very professional
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed the Hotel and would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay and found it near everything. It was convenient to have the club level food, but it was not great. I likely would have given 5 stars, but the food was just ok. Expected more for the price. Otherwise, all was good.
review.locationRemarks: near trolley

review.title: A Luxurious End to a Short Vacation
review.reviewText: My husband and I planned a short (3 day) vacation in Sonoma. Since we we had a long flight back to Boston, we decided to splurge on one night at a great hotel in San Francisco before returning home. What a great choice! The Ritz-Carlton is the epitome of luxury. It sits at the top of the hill, but just off the cable car line so that it is easy to get around. The staff was extremely gracious. We had booked a night flight, so the hotel stored our luggage after we checked out which gave us an extra day to explore San Francisco. They even gave us a complimentary limousine ride down to the Embarcadero in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was enormous and everything was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Some things in the gift shop are almost twice as much as you would pay in a store.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to the Embarcadero or Union Square. Before we left, we walked three blocks to Chinatown and had a wonderful lunch.

review.title: Less than average Rollaway beds
review.reviewText: We had requested two double beds but this was not available so staff advised that we could have a roll away bed. Originally this was charged for but was removed from the bill once I queried this. However, the linen on the rollaway bed was ripped & tatty round the edges - not the standard I would expect from this hotel. The rolloway bed was also extremely uncomfortable. A better standard of rollaway bed was expected.

review.title: Not worth the price.
review.reviewText: For the price it was not worth it. Older and worn. Thin walls. People in the next room kept us up all night. I saw other hotels that had superior locations.
review.locationRemarks: Inferior.

review.title: Great view of Chinatown and the financial building
review.reviewText: The location was perfect ! Our room had a view of a trolly and of the skyline! The amenities were utter luxury. We ordered desert through room service; I must say those were the best cookies I have ever tasted!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! Especially the bed, it was soooo comfortable, as if I was floating on a cloud!
review.locationRemarks: The loction is perfect because restaurants are walking distance. Also USF is only 15 min away. Not to mention the trollies!

review.title: the best all around
review.reviewText: outstanding, we have stayed there many times, it is always the best service and dependable
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Over priced.
review.reviewText: It was not worth it for the crazy price!!! nice hotel but to expensive! I do have to say the staff were friendly and professional.
review.negativeRemarks: No Pool and to expensive AND NO FREE WIFI
review.locationRemarks: Great in you like Chinese food as China town is right on your door step :-)

review.title: good place
review.reviewText: i love it, the stay was nice , but the comfort of the room was different...
review.locationRemarks: it was kind of hidden but it looked good

review.title: Break the Bank
review.reviewText:
First off, room I booked for our family, confirmed by Expedia, was not available. So, instead of our 2 queen beds we got one king and rollaways. After clearly asking if this would affect our rate, the answer was no, it does not affect our nightly rate. All except the surprise at checkout for the $45 a night rollaway charge, but TECHNICALLY, as they said, the room itself was same rate.

Of course, web out of date on the actual parking charge, which rang in at $76 per night. You read that right. We waited 45 minutes for our car, ending up missing dinner reservation due to our delay in getting our car. Upset, i asked the front desk if this was 'acceptable' to them.

Took an hour to get the bell desk to answer the phone

Good thing I got upset about this as decided to checkout as my $295/night stay was setting me back $468 per night, room/tax/spare bed/parking and $17/night internet that ran at a snail's pace.

To get the last laugh, the Ritz had put a hold for $1200 on my card beyond the bill itself (for damage, incidentals, and of course the layers of charges.) On checkout, was told it might take a week for that amount to get back on my account, leaving me maxed out with $2000+ in charges frozen on my card the day after my $490 one nighter.

Wife said it best. NEVER AGAIN. Some memories, like the Ritz San Francisco, are best left as memories, now bad ones.
review.positiveRemarks: When you finally get your car and realize you dont have to wait anymore for the valet
review.negativeRemarks: I think that should be obvious
review.locationRemarks: Difficult to access, with a steep, short hill and stairs that a mountain goat would complain aboujt.

review.title: Elegant and Friendly, Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Ritz-Carlton San Francisco is one of our favorite hotels in the bay area. Completely recommend it!!!

review.title: Great get-away.
review.reviewText:
Attentive employees, great food in Parallel 37, fitness center spacious and well-equipped.
Had a wonderful stay; club level a wonderful addition.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square.

review.title: Excellent spot when passing through San Francisco
review.reviewText: Club level room with excellent view of the City. One of the best RC Club Level rooms that I have stayed in.
review.positiveRemarks: City View, Catwalk access from the room windows.

review.title: Nice but nothing special
review.reviewText: In a city of elegant hotels with interesting interiors this hotel seem inappropriately overpriced. The service is good and the rooms are nice but nothing special.

review.title: Bad room choice
review.reviewText: Expedia should warn the consumer that a hotel may give you an undesirable room, if checking in late. We were stuck on the ground level, and had no view whatsoever, though I had specified an upper level room.

review.title: Great up scale hotel located near Union Square!
review.reviewText: Great service and staff....couldn't have been any happier!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for us. We were ablle to walk to Union Square, Chinatown and the Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Elton
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable stay. Room was very comfortable & location was great - close to everything.

review.title: Disappointing. Subpar for marqee name & top price
review.reviewText: (1)Sink was clogged. Had to call housekeeping. (2)No shampoo in bathroom upon check in, although supplied later when requested. (3)Room not cleaned by 3-4:00 pm. Then coffee envolopes and cups were not restocked. Supplied quickly when requested. (4)Made same day spa appointement and arranged day schedule accordingly only to be cancelled later by the spa for "Oh the appointement was tentative. We are unable to secure therapist for that time" without apology. Complained to hotel manager on duty who was absolutly of no help and showed lack of understanding or concern.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Bell captain. Check in and front desk. Concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: (1)SPA. (2)Additional charges for in-room wifi. (3)The free Lobby wifi is, unusallly, restricted to 2 hours window.

review.title: Club Level at The Ritz
review.reviewText:
We stayed Club Level. I would definitely suggest this, versus just staying in a regular room. Service is better and access to the private lounge makes the stay very "Ritz-y". ;)

Food was very good all-a-around.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Nob Hill. Next to Chinatown. Take the cable car to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: The Best!
review.reviewText: I have never met a staff that was so accommodating to our needs. Everyone was so nice and anxious to please that it was a major pleasure to stay here.

review.title: best service ever!
review.reviewText: the service was superb. staffs was very attentive. best hotel the family had stayed at ever.

review.title: Top Notch Service From Top to Bottom
review.reviewText: Same-day suit and tie pressing and shoe cleaning -- not bad for a complimentary service. Service was excellent in every area, from business to personal, throughout the hotel. In-room dining food quality was much lower than I expected in comparison.

review.title: Black Saturday in a Favorite Hotel
review.reviewText: I love this hotel and previous stays have been flawless. However one bad Saturday illustrates the difference between style and substance. The last day of the stay was ear-marked for rest and relaxation. I came back from the gym early afternoon to find the room had not been made up and had no shampoo or gel for shower. Then went to have one of the worst massages I have ever endured. Again back to room but still not made up. At 5pm reported this to Club level consierge who described this as 'fascinating'!! By 7pm still no action and again spoke to a consierge who promised to send a bottle of wine to the room!! Shampoo would have been preferred. Tried to escape the hotel on a very wet evening but driveway was in gridlock and nobody would assist getting me a cab. Grabbed an umbrella at 7.30 and walked to dinner. Despite all this I will go back soon because when it is good it is great.

review.title: Best hotel experience by far!!!
review.reviewText: Two words...Club Level!!!! By far the most luxuriest hotel experience ever! Have stayed all over the world in the finest hotels and the service here cannot be compared to anywhere! Its the end all to all hotels in the San Francisco area!!
review.locationRemarks: Location is ideal. Close to union square, 5 min cab ride to the castro.

review.title: Family friendly, great staff
review.reviewText: Our second trip to San fran in a year and we wanted a good base with our kids. We stayed at the Fairmont last time (which was fine) but the Ritz far exceeded them on staff friendliness and overall hotel decor. We have two boisterous boys and they were welcomed by all staff at all times. Nothing was too much trouble, even when we wanted to move rooms to a quieter spot. Location is great and central but be prepared for a steep walk back from Union Square (mind you you need it to work off some of the great food !)
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz is a must but book tickets onine ahead of your trip. Worth hiring a car and heading over the Golden gate Bridge to marin headlands, Muir Woods and Sausalito. The Exploratorium at the Palace of Arts was THE BEST kids science museum we have ever seen.

review.title: Did not live up to our expectations
review.reviewText: Front desk and concierge service were fantastic, the staff was friendly and responsive. However, our room was pretty standard apart from more space than usual between the Queen size beds. The beds were not comfortable, firm and lumpy, my teenage daughter thought so as well. Our note pad had one sheet of paper left on it which we used, and the pen was dried out so we had to find another source for making notes. When we arrived at our room there was a flood of water on the bathroom vanity which I didn't see due to the marble patterning. I set my makeukp bag down in it, so instantly had a soaked bag. Service to repair the leak was prompt. The first two nights of our two night stay we could hear the couple next door arguing quite clearly, after a call to security, the third night it was quiet. The air conditioner/heater was very loud and woke me up every time it turned on. We planned to eat at the famed restuarant but it turns out their Sunday brunch is no longer served, and their dining room is closed Sunday and Monday. We arrived Saturday afternoon and left Tuesday morning, so don't plan to enjoy the great cooking if you don't get reservations ahead of time for Saturday. We had a decent dinner in the lobby lounge, but an aweful dinner ordered from room service, at the Ritz with the price/tax/gratuity etc. charged it was relatively speaking one of the worst meals I've ever had. This was a big special splurge for us and an dissapointment.

review.title: Service with a smile. Its a pleasure to stay at the Ritz.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Beautiful hotel and conveniently located to the cable cars and Chinatown.

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: We just finished a four night stay in the Ritz-Carlton in San Francisco. We made a "Club Level" reservation and this made it a fantastic experience. The Club Level is limited to the 7th, 8th, and 9th floors of the hotel and it gives you access to the "Club Lounge" which is a comfortable, spacious, and enjoyable place to eat, drink, read the paper, or converse with family and friends. It serves breakfast from 7:00 to 11:00, lunch (small sandwiches, fruit, desserts with wine, coffee, tea, juice etc. from 12:00 to 4:00 pm, oeur d'oeuvres, drinks, wine, coffee, tea etc. from 4:00 to 7:00 pm and great desserts from 8:00 to 10:00 pm. A concierge service is assigned to the Club Level and everyone that worked there was extremely helpful and friendly. Parking is a little expensive ($74.00 per day) so if you don't need a car, you might just want to rely on the taxis that are always available outside the front entrance to the hotel. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable with free WIFI. All in all, worth every penny considering its Nob Hill location--we'd go back in a second!

review.title: Loved it All
review.reviewText: This was a girls weekend to shop, eat, drink and have fun. The Ritz exceeded our every expectation! The staff was exceptional, the service impeccable and the club level was great. We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will go back.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: Above all else, the Ritz Carton San Francisco staff is what makes this hotel a great place to stay.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This is one of the best Ritz-Carltons, with a superb staff and facilities. she is an old girl, but looking great in her diamonds. Parking is expensive, consider foregoing the rental car for cabs.

review.title: Good choise
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel to stay at, very friendly staff, extremely clean, spacious suits the only thing didn't like is that the food at the hotel is waaay to expensive!!!!!! Other than that very enjoyable .

review.title: 100% Improvement!
review.reviewText: ...and that was starting at a very high level to begin with. There was not a single element of our stay that we were not more than satisfied with.

review.title: Great night
review.reviewText: Concergie was great, excellent recommendations

review.title: Sophisticated, charming
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nicely decorated and centrally located. The staff were unfailingly polite and accommodating. The concierge desk was especially helpful. Only downside - the cost of dining at the hotel. The dining options were prohibitively expensive.

review.title: Neat building. Great service. OK location.
review.reviewText:
My friend and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton during the labor day weekend of 2010. We booked a Deluxe Room. The hotel building looked awesome and the room was big and comfy, exactly like in the photos. The only thing that bothered me was the noise from the street.

The single pane windows have metal rims and are old. They don't seal completely. I could feel the air coming through the corners. They are facing the street (even though it's a kind of quite street). I could hear the loud engines going by. Chinatown is just one block away so in the mornings I could also hear the Chinese music from the vendors' loudspeakers. It's kind of annoying.

But overall, it's a nice hotel. I'll stay there again and recommend to my friends.

review.title: Will ONLY stay here in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Service was impeccable here at the San Francisco Ritz! Staff was courteous and friendly! We normally stay at the Ritz when we travel and both of us would say this was the best experience to date!

review.title: Wonderful Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel as great, a few blocks from China town and several great restaurants for Breakfast and Dinner, won't recommend eating at the hotel too expensive. The locatin of the hotel is perfec, the room was nice and clean and every single staff member greeted you with a warm smile and always ready with useful tips on how to best enjoy San Fransisco. The Concierge desk was very useful in providing ideas about what to do in the city. All in all it was a great travel experience.. Can't wait to go again. The Cty is fabulous.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I don't understand what is the hype about this hotel...It like any other hotel that isn't five star...Ur only paying for a brand...

review.title: Don't Go there.
review.reviewText: The bed was bad (curved), the dining chairs had nails, the TV didn't work in the Gym. Clearly, no commitment to excellence.

review.title: Underwhelmed
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel several times before and had excellent service. Unfortunately this time was completely different. The staff was unfriendly and not helpful at all. One concierge refused to help me when I had a simple question about a tour to Alcatraz. I am not trying to be harsh. In the past I have truly enjoyed staying here which is why I returned but the staff left such a poor impression that I will not be staying elsewhere in the future. However the room itself was very spacious and clean. We had a small suite and the housekeeping staff was very attentive. I was just sad that the front desk was so unhelpful this time around.

review.title: Will definately go back
review.reviewText: Beautiful, grand, luxurious hotel with great servcie

review.title: HEAVEN ON EARTH!
review.reviewText:
The Ritz_Carlton is heaven on earth! There are no adjectives to convey how wonderful our stay at this Nob Hill institution was. We booked 7 nights in a one bedroom two bath club level room. The meals, snacks, desserts, beverages, and most of all the wonderful care taken by our concierges Alexander and Tamamo (sp?) to ensure our happiness were top-drawer. This hotel is the Hope diamond in the R-C crown. Why? See for yourself--perfection on earth. The pool and spa are impeccable. If there is a Heaven, it probably looks something like the SF R-C! BTW--We will be spending all of December--35 glorious days--at the SF R-C! Can't wait to return!
Jim O. in El Paso, Texas

review.title: Great hotel and service - Beware of parking charges
review.reviewText: The hotel and service is excellent, however, beware of charges associated with parking. Parking was $71/night and this charge should be noted.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText:
The suite we were in was beautiful and very large. Alot larger than we expected, actually.
The Concierge was most friendly and referred us to a fabulous little mom & pop italian restaurant. A couple of nights, we ordered take out since we have twins and getting out was a little hard. The people in the lobby probably assumed my husband was the delivery man when he brought the food to our room. I really love this hotel but next time, we'll probably stay closer to the shops and/or wharf.

review.title: A Great Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff was very courteous when it came to directions and/or getting a cab. They were also very helpful pointing out places to go such as restaurants and sites to see. When there were no cabs to be had they chauffeured my wife and I to a nice Italian restaurant in North Beach and went in first to make sure that they had a table for us. That is first class! Location is great, a cable car stop a block away to whisk you away to Fishermans Wharf and Alcatraz and the metro nearby which took us to the Haight and AT&T ballpark. The room was a nice size and very clean and the staff comes in a couple of times a day to straighten up. Overall a great place to stay and when we come back to San Francisco we will coming back to the Ritz!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. Won't stay anywhere else in San Francisco.

review.title: best hotel i have ever been at.
review.reviewText: The club level is great!

review.title: abramsohn
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Ritz in sf. old world style and old world service.From the candle lit foyer , to the lovely spa. A real fine out there today. Will stay again!

review.title: Great stay...beautiful place
review.reviewText: Ritz is world class. It is Amazing. Everything including the room and the pool was beautiful.

review.title: Not cheap, but excellent quality
review.reviewText: The staff has been extremely helpful and attentive, and the hotel is beautiful.

review.title: Phenomenal hotel!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time. Our room was quiet, private and beautiful. The service was impeccable. Would definitely return to the Ritz-Carlton the next time we are in San Francisco!

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: The hotel catered to all our many needs.

review.title: Really bad hotel for a 5 star. I will never come back
review.reviewText:
The hotel is far away for a luxury hotel. Is that only with the name. The personell is horrible. They are not helpful and they are anoying. They will not even open the door when I was pushing my stroller. And happened day after day. The cleaning ladies don't even understand english. You have to tell them to vacuum. Otherwise they won't do it.

Room is not upgraded at all. The conditions I would say are 3.5 star no more than that. But ofcourse every service is expensive, it is Ritz isn't it?

review.title: great service
review.reviewText: Comfort abounds

review.title: The ritz not so ritzy
review.reviewText: The Ritz Carlton in San Francisco is very beautiful. Unfortunately my experience there was not the best. I would like to hope that when staying at a hotel for this price the service there would be consitantly good. But it was not. It was hit or miss on how we were treated by the staff. Some were amazing and would go above and beyond to make our stay a comfortable one but others seemed burdened by any request or question we might have. Also the first room they put us in was a very unwelcoming room. There were only two pictures on the wall and it had a very cold feeling. Very uninviting. I don't believe I could recommend this hotel to anyone only on the fact that I wouldn't be sure on how you would be treated while staying there.

review.title: Grat hotel
review.reviewText: Loved it!

review.title: Book dinner reservations in advance
review.reviewText: The chef at the hotel had great reviews, but when we tried to get dinner reservations it was immpossible. Dissappointing.....

review.title: good place to stay
review.reviewText: Good location; very nice staffs. The only down side is the surrounding streets are steep.

review.title: What a remarkable hotel!
review.reviewText: We had the time of our lives at this hotel!! We were treated like royalty by the staff! The room was very clean and comfortable and the beds were to die for! The location was perfect for touring the city.

review.title: Excellent Nob Hill Location
review.reviewText: On par with most other the Ritz Carlton properties, the Nob Hill location was a friendly, accommodating and comfortable hotel for a four night stay for three. The room and bath facilities were spacious, with none of us ever feeling cramped. Hotel staff was helpful, especially the valets in arranging transportation to and from a popular sporting event. Workout facilities a little cramped, but includes a variety of cardio and weight equipment. While we didn't dine in the hotel restaurant, we enjoyed cocktails in the lobby lounge. Very convenient location for tourists. Overall we were extremely pleased with the Ritz Carlton Nob Hill and would definitely return.

review.title: Lovely Hotel, Plush and Comfortable
review.reviewText: It's not the cheapest hotel in San Francisco, but it certainly was a wonderful place to come 'home' to after an activity-packed day. Always welcomed at the door, greeted by the front desk, bottles of water and apples out for returning (or leaving!) guests. We just felt so pampered. Except for one crodgity concierge (that should not be in that position)everyone was so nice and helpful. And being right around the corner from Chinatown was fun too!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Convenient and very clean. Didn't have time to see much of the hotel because there's so much to do in Frisco. Everyone was very nice and helpful.

review.title: Nice weekend getaway
review.reviewText: We enjoyed out visit to the Ritz in SF for a quick weekend getaway. The Hotel is stately and an iconic representation of SF. Our room was nice, comfortable and a good value. For a Ritz the bathroom was small and difficult to navigate for two people.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Very nice, great location, comfortable rooms

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Everything I'd hoped it would be. Concierge was especially helpful on several occassions with getting us tickets to the museum, suggesting restaurants etc. Would go back in a heartbeat. Only con is if you're walking it is at the top of Nob Hill - so it's a steep climb for the last two blocks, but that helps with walking off the extra calories from the good food!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I had a generally positive experience. The hotel is beautiful, and the service was generally good. There's a few negative points. As others have mentioned, it's on a hill so if you take the subway, you have a pretty steep climb. The woman who did the evening turn down service insisted on slamming doors and making a racket, which was disturbing. Often, when I returned to the hotel, no one opened the door. 5 star service?

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location -- walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square. Nice, spacious room. Mostly spotless except there was a used coffee filter in the coffee maker. Staff were very attentive and efficient. Rooms were made up by late morning everyday. Food at the hotel was good too. The hotel gave us the use of their chauffeured car, which got us to the Opera in plenty of time. Nice touch. I will definitely be back.

review.title: Just what you would expect from a Ritz!
review.reviewText: It was a very enjoyable stay. The staff was warm, friendly and very helpful.

review.title: Let Down
review.reviewText: This is the 3rd time that I stayed at this 5 star property. I must say I was let down on this visit. I checked and and usually you are welcomed back and this did not happen. I was given a very small room and the bathroom was medicore. I was always very impressed before. I was in San Francisco 4 weeks earlier and stayed in a deluxe room at the Fairmont and the room was better. I have to say the Ritz was previously my favorite hotel and I will not stay there again. Not worth the money. Check out the Huntington, Fairmont, or Mark Hopkins less expensive and worth the price... I will not stay there again.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Sandwiched between Union Square and Chinatown, it is a good location. Would have preferred to stay closer to the public transit, but was not too far to walk.

review.title: What do you expect? It's the Ritz
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: The staff were great at Ritz Carlton SF
review.reviewText: Everything was great. SPA can be upgraded to be more attractive. I do not use spas but in few occasions I had to go take a shower there and it was not up to par wit the rest of the hotel.

review.title: Royalty
review.reviewText: Great

review.title: We would go back again for sure!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is awesome! The rooms are huge and the beds are sooooo comfortable! It is truly a 5 star hotel! If your going out to dinner make sure you ask for the hotel car!

review.title: The Ritz-Carlton - San Francisco - Brilliant
review.reviewText: One of the best hotels in the World..... Superb staff, facilities and location.

review.title: The Ritz Made My Trip A Trip Of A Lifetime
review.reviewText: My wife & I spent 10 fabulous days there during the 2008-2009 holiday season. We arrived the Monday after Christmas & departed January 8th. Everyday there was a pleasure. The hotel staff treat you like royalty. The hotel was decked out for the holidays, very classy. All the staff acknowledge you as you roam the premises. The concierge desk is super imformative & knowledgable on everything in San Francisco. The "Terrace Restuarant" offers 5 star fare, superb in every way. The room we had was on the 5th floor on the front facade of the hotel facing Stockton St. The standard room we had was very large, comfortable & very plush. The room had an enormous & beautiful marble bathroom with double sinks & stocked with Bulgari toiletries. The room also had a very well stocked minibar, a single cup coffee maker, 3 large closets, drawer space in tv cabinet, a flat screen tv, large desk with internet connections (did not use them), 2 elegant armchairs & 1 ottoman. The hotel is very centrally located, just minutes to Union Square (a couple of blocks), China Town (less than a block away) & Downtown (is several blocks away, kind of far). The Nob Hill area is magnificent in appearance & extremely hilly, which makes walking difficult if you are not used to it. Very romantic hotel, we very broken hearted to leave the Ritz-Carlton. We can not wait to revisit again.

review.title: Christmas at the Ritz a Mixed Blessing
review.reviewText: Overall, the stay was good. Nicely elegant. The cleaning staff were excellent as were the front desk clerks, but the concierge service ranged from civil to condescending and critical. Room service was above par and prompt. Amazing fitness room. Easy access to China Town, the Wharf and downtown. One MAJOR downside for me: you pay for wireless service in the room and cannot access the hotel computers without a credit card. Seems awfully penny-pinching for such a top end hotel.

review.title: Terribly overpriced
review.reviewText: Updates required.Food quality was good, but we left hungry!

review.title: Gets it right from beginning to end
review.reviewText: The Ritz in San Francisco is a wonderful place to stay. The staff is extremely helpful and nice. The hotel is beautiful and the restaurant is top notch. All in all a very pleasant stay.

review.title: Great hotel in every category
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful and in a great location. I found the staff to be incredibly nice and accomdating. I even left 2 jackets in the room when I left and they mailed them to me at no cost. Overall a fabulous experience.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: The Hotel was amazing, the staff were amazing, the spa was not...the spa appears to be makeshift, uninviting and old.

review.title: Wonderful Service. Cleanliness Poor
review.reviewText: From the minute we stepped out of the car every staff member was helpful and courteous. The Room was comfortable. One complaint would be the two DOUBLE beds. The rooms size could have accommodated two King size beds, so I would have thought for the price and level of luxury, two QUEENS would have been the minimum. Two QUEENS is San Francisco is a standard for hotels on third the price. Our main complaint was in the bathroom. It had lots of marble and loads of amenities, but it stunk with what we best could describe as body oder. We called housekeeping and went to dinner and they tried to cover it up with scents while we dined, but it was still there. I know the place was clean. the best we could figure out, is that it was the old toilet or maybe even the pipes or water. The smell was repulsive and bad enough not to want to return to this hotel. Beautiful property, wonderful staff, but the bathroom odor was definitely a "total experience" killer.

review.title: Choose rooms in the back of the hotel during the week
review.reviewText: During the week on school days, after 8:00 in the morning, a guy gets on a mega phone and YELLS at the drivers dropping off their children at the private school across the street. My husband and I were there for our 20th anniversary, yes, he was up attending to business, but I wanted to sleep in and relax...forget that.

review.title: Beautiful Stay
review.reviewText: The Ritz Carlton on Nob Hill is a fantastic location and an amazingly beautiful hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and attractive. A great place to stay.

review.title: Anniversary weekend at the RC in SF
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the RC very much. The service wasn't as great as it should have been or can be- our room wasnt made up until after 5 pm, and then they forgot a few items; the valet parking attendant was belligerent with my husband when he tipped the wrong one of the three standing around our car- but everyone was polite, the hotel was beautiful and we will return. In particular, the staff who served us at tea were great.

review.title: Superior Service
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel that exceeded our expectations. We were warmly greeted by all staff each time we left and returned to the hotel, felt very comfortable and at home at the Ritz! Close to everthing and steps away from cable car access not to mention, one block away from China town! Can't wait to return. Great splurge for a special event!

review.title: Impressive service
review.reviewText: The Ritz definitely has figured out how to provide service. It was almost a gauntlet of hello and good morning to get in and out of the hotel. The room was well apportioned and very clean. For the most part, housekeeping was quite speedy and unobtrusive. The building itself is beautiful. I had the standard room and it was an adequate size, but a bit smaller than most standard rooms. I think the main thing it is missing is views. With multiple tall buidings around it, there are not too many rooms with a great view of the city.

review.title: Such a treat.
review.reviewText: In the heart of the action, this is a lovely hotel with an excellent staff.

review.title: Elegance in S.F.
review.reviewText: This hotel exudes elegance AND hospitality. Not cheap, but not stuffy at all. The entire staff works to ensure you are comfortable and welcomed.

review.title: Great hotel with exceptional staff
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is the best you will find. They are attentive to your every need. The hotel is one block from Chinatown and three blocks from Union Square. You can get to Pier 39, and AT&T Park th opposite way with a 15 minute walk. Great views inside and out of hotel.

review.title: Pamper Palace
review.reviewText: If you want to feel pampered by friendly, gracious staff, then the Ritz Carlton in San Francisco is the place. We felt truly welcomed and the staff bent over backwards to make our stay pleasurable.

review.title: Great Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: it's the best service. all employees are very nice and kind.

review.title: San Francisco's Ritz is a definite 5 star!
review.reviewText: Absolutely the finest accommodations ever! We loved everything about the Ritz -- every attention to every detail was made by the staff. Would return to the Ritz in a heartbeat!!

review.title: The Best Hotel Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is fabulous, especially the staff, who were all excellently trained and gracious. I have never had better or friendlier service.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: It's a very nice hotel to stay at. Good service, although slight inconveniences. Would go back.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: The staff was willing to help in any way. They always did so with a smile.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The Ritz Carleton was everything we expected and a grand stay for a nice vacation. The service was superb and the location ideal for access to most of the city sites.

review.title: Not impressed. Much deferred maintenance
review.reviewText: Hotel is getting older with deferred maintenance.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: I was extremely impressed with this 5-star hotel in SF. It was a bargain deal for the spring sale, and it was by far the best hotel that I've ever been to, in terms of service, cleanliness, condition, luxury, and comfort. I would definitely recommend to anyone!

review.title: Wonderful luxury hotel
review.reviewText: We just enjoyed our stay there. All the people are welcoming. The room was large and comfortable. We had a little trouble with the hot water for the bath tub on the first night, but it was fixed on the next day. I think it is worth spending the amount for Ritz Carlton.

review.title: Good, Not Great
review.reviewText: The Ritz-Carlton San Francisco is an impressive structure and well-located on Nob Hill. Many people were impressed that everyone seems to know their name. That's because many staff members wear an wireless headset, like in Banana Republic, so when you arrive and the doorman asks your name, he alerts others. I've stayed at another Ritz-Carlton and the one downside is the inconsistency of their staff. They tend to be young and energetic but can be forgetful and not as polished as they should be. For instance, guest services didn't follow through on a couple of small requests and the one doorman got into a shouting match with a cabby over who had "next." One of the three days we were there, housekeeping failed to restock the coffee bar and I noticed they never removed the hair that had collected in the drain. Also, the water pressure for the shower was sub-par and the showerhead had been re-attached to the tile wall in a shoddy manner. The hotel has a regal quality, which one would expect for the high room rates, but they filled the central courtyard with what appears to be a permanent tent for private events so the opportunity to walk and sit in this pleasant space has been lost.

review.title: Impressive Hotel and Great Location
review.reviewText: Excellent accomodations, great location, memorable experience

review.title: Ritz was wonderful
review.reviewText: From the moment we entered the hotel we were treated like royalty. The concierge took care of everything. He booked us great dinner reservations, planned our excursions and even printed our bording passes. The location was great as well. The two main cable car lines had stops within a block from the hotel. My wife and I would recommend the Ritz Carlton to everyone.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: The one bedroom suite was amazing and spacious. The service was also terrific. The only not so great aspect was the flavor of the food that we had at the hotel. The presentation was beautiful, but the taste just fell short. It wasn't bad, just had boring flavor. I would absolutely return to the hotel and definately recommend it to others.

review.title: as much luxury as expected
review.reviewText: my husband and I were very much pleased with the services, food and cleanliness of the Ritz-Carlton, felt like we were puttin' on the ritz.

review.title: Superb!
review.reviewText: The luxury and customer service were unsurpassed. The dining on club level was outstanding.

review.title: didn't like the bathroom
review.reviewText: to save water resources, i would have preferred a low flush toilet to a low flow shower head....had to run around the shower to get wet!

review.title: High Expectations - Well Met
review.reviewText: Excellent and friendly service in a very nice location a few blocks away from the hustle and bustle of Union Square, but close to Chinatown, the North Shore, and an easy walk to the Ferry Building. Made for a very enjoyable getaway weekend of sight seeing.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful espacially when we asked for directions to attractions. Very friendly staff called you by your last name whenever they saw you also every time you came back to the hotel the people at the front desk welcomed you back. Rooms were comfortable. In room dining was great,but a little pricey. Valet parking was very expensive. This hotel is at a great location so a car is not really necessary. It is a wonderful hotel and worth every penny and I would most definatley go back to it again. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: Impeccable service
review.reviewText: We spent 5 nights in the hotel in March 2008 and had a great time. The staff was extremely attentioned all the time, the room was bright and clean, the fitness center including pool very relaxing. Only disappointing spot was the hotel restaurant, whose reputation we found above its delivery. One of the best hotel I have been in, worth the price !

review.title: superb hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service and attentiveness to guests' needs. Friendly staff, helpful in all regards. Well appointed room with friendly and thorough housekeeping.

review.title: A beautiful hotel with an ideal location.
review.reviewText: We found the staff extremely helpful, especially the wait staff in the Terrace Restaurant. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast each morning while chatting with our waiters about possible day trips or excursions both within and outside the city. It was a wonderful experience from start to finish.

review.title: San Frans best hotel
review.reviewText: Simply awesome

review.title: One of our favorites
review.reviewText: Have stayed in European hotels and Four Seasons, as well as other Ritz Carltons, but this has been and remains one of our favorites. Great staff and coordination among the staff. Fantastic location.

review.title: great rooms, great service
review.reviewText: Got a surprising bargain at the Ritz Carlton and took advantage of it. Rooms were beautiful and comfortable, service was superb. Somehow the greeter in the lobby new me by name as I emerged from the taxi from the airport! Would stay here at twice the price.

review.title: Too expensive for the service quality
review.reviewText: In Japan Ritz-Carlton has a perception as the best customer service provider, but I guess it may apply to the ones located in Japan. We were frustrated by their inconsistent services due to lack of information sharing among departments/staff. The info sharing supported by computer systems is supposed to be this hotel chain's source of reputation, but that was not the case at least at The R-C, San Francisco.

review.title: A wonderful experience
review.reviewText: We spent a week staying on the club level. Our room was extremely comfortable in all respects and the staff without exception were polite, helpful and friendly. The concierge staff in particular showed individual attention to detail; making us feel noticed and individually attended to. Thank you for a much appreciated escape.

review.title: terrible service
review.reviewText: very poor service in most areas

review.title: Outstanding service and location
review.reviewText: The accomodations were outstanding. All hotel staff members went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. We loved staying there and will return with our children sometime soon.

review.title: Outstanding service
review.reviewText: The Ritz Carlton SFO, is not only a very elegant hotel, but the service is impeccable. My family enjoyed a week long break there on the club level and we were looked after so well. The staff are not only friendly, but they personalise everything. The attention to detail was superb. I would highly recommend this hotel and if you can, do stay on the club level, it is definitely worth it.

review.title: Truly Luxury
review.reviewText: It was my first time to San Francisco and staying a Ritz. Both were unbelievable, the staff and the hotel was absolutely hands down the best I've ever stayed in. The city was fantastic (actually started looking at real estate). Will definitely stay again whenever I visit San Francisco.

review.title: A fantastic experience in itself!
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed on the Club floor for three nights. The 'food presentations' (meals) and all drinks (tea, coffee, soft drinks, wine, Champagne, spirits) are all included in the rate, so the price difference - and the extra attentiveness and helpfulness of the staff are easily worth it. We're both vegetarian and special notice was taken of this, no questions asked. We also did pay for one meal in the hotel - the Vegetarian 'Taster' Menu in the Dining Room restaurant. This was the best meal I have EVER had in my life, and the service and wine (I chose a mid-priced bottle of Napa Merlot from the very copious list) were superb. It's not cheap, but well worth it as one of life's major food experiences. The hotel is ideally located just a few blocks from Union Square and the main shopping area, with a nice downhill walk through Chinatown in the other direction to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel is also right by the California Street cable car route should you need assistance back up the hill! The room was comfortably furnished without being gross or too 'bling'. The bed was large and comfortable, the room was quiet and the cleanliness excellent. Overall I would rate this hotel as Extremely Highly Recommended - we will definitely be going back.

review.title: Continued Excellence
review.reviewText: The Ritz continues to exemplify excellence in customer service and amenities. Between the many hellos, guidance from the concierge, to the pristine rooms we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

review.title: A pleasureable stay
review.reviewText: Good and quite location, excellent customer service. I highly recommend the Ritz.

review.title: A truly outstanding property...one of my best hotel experiences ever.
review.reviewText: My wife, daughter and I just spent 4 nights at the fabulous Ritz-Carlton in San Francisco. The room was large and comfortable. The staff was friendly, gracious and attentive. The hotel is elegant yet warm. I've stayed at the Crillon in Paris, the Athenaeum in London and the Palace in New York...and this Ritz-Carlton was one of the most enjoyable hotel experiences I've ever had because the staff was always so helpful! I highly recommend my new favorite property in San Francisco...the Ritz-Carlton!

review.title: Club level - wonderful!!
review.reviewText: We loved the club level experience, especially the continental breakfast. The service here is exceptional! The room was great - had an HDTV, and the bed was so comfortable! I loved the pillows so much (they were very soft).

review.title: Earned it's stars!!
review.reviewText: Stayed club level during Spring Break with our 12 year old son. It was wonderful. The pool and workout area were great. Club level offerings were delicious, service was superb and room was so comfortable. Great location to trolley cars, bus or taxi. Right next to China Town and only blocks to Union Square. Ritz offers a free car to any place within 2 mile radius. Took cat adventure catamaran cruise on bay and it was great and the 3.5 hr city tour. Both were reccommended by concierges. We can't wait to go back now that we know more about the city. Fisherman's Wharf great for fresh seafood!!

review.title: Like Royalty
review.reviewText: Wonderful Experiance. The staff is courteous and attentive. The rooms are spacious and extremely comfortable and well maintained. Every thing you would expect and more from the Ritz.

review.title: Fantastic Location!
review.reviewText: Very impressed by the club level service. The club concierge staff truly went above and beyond for us. The regular concierge(s) did not seem to be as knowledgable, and we just ended up going back upstairs to the club level to get what we needed. Spend the extra for club level service, it is worth every penny. The savings in bottled water, breakfast, and lattes to go more than made up the cost difference, not to mention the caviar service and open bar in the evenings.

review.title: superb sevice
review.reviewText: From the moment we walked in the door we had a wonderful experience. Club level definitely worth it, especially with teenagers,

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Ritz in SF was an excellent 5-start hotel. The staff was top-notch. We would definately stay there again.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: I have stayed in some top hotels before, but this is one of the nicest. Easy location for all the top attractions via the rail system. The only thing I did not like was the business center. You will be charged for its use. Really disapointing to me. So many other hotels offer free internet and business center usage, it really was an unplesant shock.

review.title: The Definition of Luxury, Service and Relaxation!
review.reviewText: From the moment you pull into the hotel to the time you're waving farewell, you are the king (or queen for that matter)! Anyone that thinks customer service died in the 20th century hasn't stayed at the Ritz-Carlton. It is each of the staff member's personal goal to make sure you have everything you! We stayed on the Club level and it was money well spent. The food in the Club Lounge was perfect. The spa and pool area was like a peaceful retreat to the mostly noisy and bustling city around the hotel. Filled with scented candles and soft music, you really get the full relaxation you need while down there. The rooms were nicely decorated and the bed and bedding were so soft. Luxurious bathrobes and slippers were ready for us each day and they even had small sizes for the kids! Even the roll-away bed we ordered was soft and comfortable. As for the location, it was close to just about everything. And any place that was further than walking distance we just hopped in one of the "House Cars" and got whisked away in luxury to any place we wanted around the city. My wife and I really enjoyed being driven to dinner in a brand new Mercedes-Benz S550 and when we were done a quick call to the Hotel and we were being picked up right outside the restaurant. Talk about VIP service! Being S.F., if you do decide to walk to your destination, be prepared to walk up and down some steep hills. We are definitely going to be staying here again and pretty much at any Ritz-Carlton available!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I stayed in one of the suites on the club level,theses are simply the best with complimentary drinks and food all day.All in all the staff were most courteous and professional,however after only staying 2 nights instead of 7 because some rather rude immature member of staff was completely condescending towards me and at a small fortune a night I aint taking that off noone so I checked out!I would probably recommend this hotel to the more mature who are looking for a peaceful time,or a company director with a company credit card and who isnt paying for it themselves.Certainly not for a young,virile single man like myself.A little on the stuffy side!!

review.title: 5 Star All the Way *****
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the Ritz-Carlton. Having an indoor pool and spa was great for San Francisco. We stayed at the Club level-Five food presentations everyday. Caviar on Fridays. The staff called us by name which is incredible to me. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. We only left the hotel twice; to the Star Room Night Club and Chinatown for a walk. No need to leave luxury.

review.title: A luxurious experience
review.reviewText: This hotel offered impeccable customer service and hospitality. The food was delicious but extremely overpriced (not worth it in San Francisco when there are so many great restaurants to choose from) The only real complaint I have is Internet access in the room was not complimentary.

review.title: Luxury at its best
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the San Francisco Ritz-Carlton several times now in the last six months for business and they never fail to make me feel right at home. Whether asking that they arrange dinner reservations, provide directions, or even if you need an extra umbrella when it is raining outside, the service is impeccable. The rooms are elegant and nicely appointed, and the staff is amazing. If you are looking for a hotel that truly takes care of its guests for your stay in San Francisco, it does not get any better than the Ritz-Carlton.

review.title: Absolutely fantastic
review.reviewText: This hotel is almost perfect. The staff is unfailingly attentive, there are daily calls to ensure everything is satisfactory. The TV needed attention, and it was promptly and efficiently attended to. The food presentation on the club level was outstanding, the concierge attentive and competent. I observed the following in two days: At the breakfast service, a staff member went back into the kitchen and delivered three ramkins of berries to a guest who had missed them on the buffet; at the evening service, a young child (clearly used to to such accommodations!) expressed a desire for salmon, and the staff person brought out a tray of paoched salmon for the youngster's selection. In a word: unbelievable.

review.title: grreat hotel
review.reviewText: fantastic hotel in a great location

review.title: We will be coming back very soon
review.reviewText: We will be coming back very soon My wife and I went to San Francisco for a pre-Valentines day weekend. Although the weather was not perfect we really enjoyed ourselves in San Francisco and staying at the Ritz-Carlton made it even better. The hotel staff was very friendly and attentive. The rooms and other amenities were all first class. We can not wait to go back to San Francisco and stay at the Ritz-Carlton.

review.title: The best hotel in San Francisco, it is worth climbing the hill!
review.reviewText: What a fabulous experience. If you can, do the club lounge, it is totally worth it. The hotel staff are gracious and friendly and seem genuinely interested in making your stay the best they can. The only thing that could be improved are the bath tubs- ours looked a little dated and didn't fill up real well.

review.title: Quality hotel facility
review.reviewText: Hotel & its staff were first rate!!!

review.title: Pampered and well fed!
review.reviewText: Excellent location high atop a SF hill at the corner of Stockton and California Streets where the cable car stops. Only one block from Chinatown with its fabulous restaurants, bakeries, tea rooms and shopping, and our corner room had a view of the bay and the city. We enjoyed in-room dining on several occasions and the food at the Ritz is excellent! The hotel staff was professional, welcoming and extremely accommodating. We felt very pampered and refreshed, and will definitely stay at the Ritz-Carlton again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This was without a doubt one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff was both friendly and very helpful, making reservations for day trips and restaurants very easy. The rooms were beautifully kept and the house cleaning did a great job each day. The rooms were very quiet, no outside noise or noise from other rooms. The room service was great and moderately priced. I cannot wait to go back!

review.title: Club Level at its best
review.reviewText: The Club Level at the Ritz Carlton is the pinnicle of luxury - 5 different food and drink presentations during the day and evening - The staff was most accommodating and friendly - This is my second time staying at the Club Level at the Ritz - there were 4 of us (my 2 daughters and best friend) we had a wonderful time and can't wait to go back

review.title: Fantastic staff, attentive service and great location
review.reviewText: Rooms were well appointed and spacious. The location was excellent and the hotel was a great value for the money. I would rate the Rit-Carlton as much better than other luxury hotels in San Francisco.

review.title: We will be coming back very soon
review.reviewText: My wife and I went to San Francisco for a pre-Valentines day weekend. Although the weather wasn't perfect we really enjoyed ourselves in San Francisco and staying at the Ritz-Carlton made it even better. The hotel staff was very friendly and attentive. The rooms and other amenities were all first class. We can not wait to go back to San Francisco and stay at the Ritz-Carlton.

review.title: Met our expectations and then some
review.reviewText: One of the premier hotels in San Francisco. The service is friendly and very efficient. They succeed at giving you a small hotel feel, in a large hotel. they upgraded us to the club level, which can really spoil you for future visits.

review.title: Can't wait to stay at another Ritz- Carlton
review.reviewText: The service was above and beyond our expectations. The concierges were amazing! Everyone greeted you by name and you felt really special. Location was great. Also loved the Bvlgari goodies in the bathroom. We had the very basic room and whilst it was more than adequate, would love to try a suite in future, to ensure that you got the "whole" package. A definite for anyone who likes to feel pampered and beautiful!

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Ritz was wonderful. The service was outstanding and the hotel was beautiful. We're planning to go back in September can't wait.

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Great location within the City yet quiet and very elegant. Stayed four nights with one day of inclement weather so my family was glad to have the indoor pool available.

review.title: A life of luxury....
review.reviewText: Even though the Ritz is a small hotel, it's elegance and the friendliness/helpfulness of it's staff exceeds all others. Noteworthy is the attitude of the staff that you ARE a guest and you are treated accordingly. All issues (minor - one being too close to the street noise) were resolved promptly and courtesously. I would stay at ANY Ritz after this experience - I highly recommend it!

review.title: Didn't want to leave!
review.reviewText: We stayed on the Club Level. The service was outstanding. They truly know how to make you feel at home. The staff are so friendly and helpful. We're making this a holiday tradition for our family.

review.title: My husband was on his way to the middle east (Navy duty). We really enjoyed our stay and want to go
review.reviewText: My husband and I wanted to spend a few special days together before he went back to a war zone. We have been married for 27 year. He has been to war zone 5 times during our marriage. Every time he goes, it is more difficult. The staff at the hotel was so very supportive!! They met our every need and desire!! We both look forward to spending our reunion at this wonderful hotel and all the wonderful, supportive, and generous staff!!! All our thanks to you for assisting in making this very special time a very memorable time for the two of us!!!! Thank you All so very much!!

review.title: Amazing Service!!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff set a new standard for service. From the moment we walked in, where we were greeted by name and offered refreshments, through the time we were leaving, we received the best service possible.

review.title: As good as expected, andthen some!
review.reviewText: The name says it all. Quality, friendly service. Helpfull, Pampering staff. Cleanliness and comfort surrounded by worldly amenities. The location is prime, perched on a hill central to everything San Francisco has to offer. My only complaint - the stay was too short. Next time I will ensure enough time to enjoy the city as well as the hotel. Thank-you Ritz-Carlton.

review.title: exceptional service
review.reviewText: Service was exceptional, check-in to check-out. Staff was very attentive. Sunday Jazz brunch was fanstatic.

review.title: Can't say enough!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Ritz-Carlton was the most incredible hotel stay of our lives. We have never been treated better, from the minute our car stopped until the minute we left. The rooms were spacious, really clean, and very comfortable. Room service was prompt and delicious. We can't say enough!

review.title: Great Hotel, Comfortable Rooms
review.reviewText: Overall ... 9.5

review.title: Ritz is pricey, but nice
review.reviewText: It's pricey here, but the rooms feel luxurious, if not large - ours was average size. The walls are VERY thick - no noises from neighbors. The staff was excellent, very friendly and helpful. Be prepared for a very steep walk when you walk to the hotel. The walk to the wharf is very nice, through Chinatown.

review.title: Lived up to reputation
review.reviewText: The most service oriented Hotel I have ever been to. Friendly, welcoming and professional. They say you are very important as a guest to them - and they mean it! Fresh flowers everywhere.

review.title: The Service & Care of their Patron is Over the Top
review.reviewText: There is good reason why the Ritz - Carlton is known as the best. They are Hoteling at it's very best! - I recommend this Hotel and the club level floors to anyone wanting rest, care, fun and privacy! All service oriented business should send their staff & managers to the Ritz for just one day to absorb their innate Customer Service. The client truly feels as if the Hotel Staff enjoys assisting clients - and they love their job!! The best - and I have traveled the world.

review.title: Not the best rooms.......
review.reviewText: Well, the lobby and the lobby lounge is as classy as can get! there is a great staff that will do your every comand. beautiful art gallery in the lobby.The rooms on the other hand arent the best. The beds were unbalanced and very,very uncomfortable. didnt even get a good night's sleep. I guess you can say that the great staff makes up for their uncomfortable rooms.

review.title: Best Hotel I have stayed in
review.reviewText: The Ritz-Carlton San Francisco is a pleasure from check in to check out. The staff is extremely professional and goes the extra mile to accomodate your every need. The hotel is an exquisite condition, and the location is ideal for any type of trip into the Bay Area.

review.title: Outstanding Staff
review.reviewText: We found the staff exceptionally accomodating overall, making us feel very welcome.  The offer to take us to our restaurant instead of calling a cab was much appreciated.
